= Install Photologue =

* Note: The following instructions are for the 0.5 branch and later *

== Get The Files ==

You can download the latest release of Photologue [http://code.google.com/p/django-photologue/downloads/list here] or you can check out the newest version using subversion from [http://django-photologue.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/photologue/ http://django-photologue.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/photologue/].

== Install The App ==

Unzip or copy the Photogue application directory into your project directory (where your settings.py file is.

Add "photologue" your installed_apps setting:

{{{
INSTALLED_APPS = (
    # other installed apps
    'photologue',
)
}}}

*Be sure your MEDIA_URL and MEDIA_ROOT settings are correct!*

Add the following to yourproject.urls:

{{{
urlpatterns += patterns('',
        (r'^photologue/', include('photologue.urls')),
)
}}}

Copy the included example templates into one of your TEMPLATE_DIRS (under a subdirectory named "photologue") and modify as needed.

== Admin Thumbnails ==

Create a new `PhotoSize` with the name "thumbnail" to get thumbnail previews in the admin interface.
